description: Bacterial spot causes small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit. It thrives in warm, wet conditions.
Possible Steps: Use copper-based bactericides. Avoid overhead watering and remove infected plants.

description: Healthy tomato plants show vibrant green leaves, strong stems, and no signs of pests or disease.
Possible Steps: Maintain proper spacing, watering, and fertilization. Monitor regularly for signs of pests or disease.

description: Early blight is a fungal disease that causes concentric brown spots on older leaves, often leading to defoliation.
Possible Steps: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil. Rotate crops and remove infected debris.

description: Late blight causes dark, greasy lesions on leaves and fruit. It spreads rapidly in cool, wet weather.
Possible Steps: Use resistant varieties. Apply fungicides and ensure good air circulation.

description: Leaf mold appears as yellow spots on the upper leaf surface and olive-green mold underneath.
Possible Steps: Use resistant cultivars and improve air flow. Apply organic or chemical fungicides.

description: This fungal disease forms circular, grayish-tan lesions with dark borders on leaves.
Possible Steps: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides such as mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

description: Spider mites cause yellow speckling and webbing on leaves, leading to leaf drop.
Possible Steps: Use insecticidal soap or neem oil. Increase humidity and release natural predators.

description: Target spot appears as brown spots with concentric rings on leaves and fruits.
Possible Steps: Remove infected leaves and apply appropriate fungicides.

description: A viral disease causing leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth, transmitted by whiteflies.
Possible Steps: Control whiteflies with insecticides and use resistant varieties.

description: Mosaic virus causes mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves, reducing yield.
Possible Steps: Use resistant seeds. Avoid smoking near plants and disinfect tools.

description: Powdery mildew presents as white, powdery fungal growth on leaf surfaces, usually in dry climates.
Possible Steps: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Ensure good air circulation and remove infected leaves.
